page.title: 19MEDIEVAL MARKET
page.content: The rector,the right reverend Alan Shaw opened Alcester's annual{Medieval {Market}on Sunday 17th June.The High Baliff and the Court Leet were there in their finery.Stalls lined the High Street selling various wares and were manned by people dressed in medieval costume.Many were dressed in elaborate rich costume and others in peasant costume of the day.There were various games to play and also a replica of the stocks housing a local citizen.Wet sponges could be purchased and thrown. A reminder of punishments of bygone days. Each stall had to purchase a licence from the council before they could sell their wares on market day. Many of the stalls were run for charity and made up the funds of the High Baliff's charity.
